intro: Poeppigia procera, commonly known as the desert rose, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems that store water, allowing it to survive in dry environments. The plant produces striking, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, which bloom during the rainy season. Its leaves are typically small and succulent, reducing water loss through transpiration. Poeppigia procera is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its resilience and aesthetic appeal.
